docs.text: Lexicon AI : An Artificial Intelligence. This term is generally used to refer to simple artificial intelligences with specific purposes. AGI : An Artificial General Intelligence. This refers to AI capable of developing new skills and objectives. AGI are generally forbidden or heavily monitored in most societies as they are feared to become singularities . Angel : A personal assistant AI directly embedded in your MPU . Most people have angels since childhood and develop a particular relationship with them. As they are directly embedded in your MPU , they can interface with your perception and talk to you or even manifest visually in the Mesh . Angels are devoted and useful assistants that can use your inserts to navigate the Grid , helping you to access information, synthesize it, navigate easily, ... Angels are usually a pseudofork of their user or of someone close, but they may be entirely artificial intelligence with programmable personality, the pseudofork of a famous person or even more exotic things... Aug : An augmentation. A device integrated to your shell that provides you with an augmentation compared to base human. Bioshell : [...] Cortical stack : A chip that constantly scans your MPU and stores your ego . Daemon : An Angel with softwares allowing to anonymize its user. Contrary to most of the population, your actions may not publicly available on the Grid . Daemon fakes public authentications, automatically tries to remove or falsify your traces in the local Mesh , ... Ego : Your identity, your memories, hopes, beliefs, drives and regrets. It can be stored in an cortical stack that serves as a dynamic save in case your shell is destroyed. Exhuman : A transhuman that thinks ascension can be accessed only by rejecting what's left of humanity in transhumanity. While exhumans come in various shapes and the details of their ideology varies a lot, they all share this idea of abandonning the human drives and beliefs that we kept from our biological ancestry. Some of them push forking at its limits, creating competing communities of a single forked individual. Some interface with swarms of shells, others use nanotech swarms as a shell. Some study stolen alien artifacts to incorporate their technologies, others do even weirder stuffs in their hidden habitats. Exhumans are generally outcasts and some of them engage with terrorism to rebel against transhuman societies. Fork : A fork is a copied ego . As a copy, it has the same memories, drives, beliefs, ... Of course, once the fork is running on an independent MPU , it progressively becomes someone else, diverging while their experiences slowly drift from the original. Having multiple forks of the same ego is generally considered a major crime in most societies. Grid (The) : The Grid describes the entirety of the information networks used by transhumans. The Grid is not a single network with fixed protocols but is instead a collection of networks with various properties, more or less connected between one another. Some parts of the Grid are heavily surveilled and controlled, while others are totally anonymous and free. Some parts are corporate encrypted internal servers, anonymous black markets, gamified VR social networks, etc... The Grid is not just an abstract construct, parts of it are embedded in the physical world and are called meshes . Some transhuman even live exclusively on the Grid in their infoshells . Habitat : Habitats are the constructions where transhumans live. Habitats are what protect transhumanity against the void of the space, solar radiation, toxic atmospheres and extreme temperatures. Infoshell : [...] Mesh : A Mesh describes the local ecosystem of habitat-embedded technologies and connected objects. Meshes are the parts of the Grid that layers on top of the physical world. MPU : Mind Processing Unit. The part of your shell that loads your ego and runs it. It may be a biological brain, a silicon brain or even a server. Anything with enough computation power may be a MPU. Pseudofork : Similar to a fork , except that it only keeps specific part of your ego (preferences, semantics, ...) and runs an AI with this data. As such, a pseudofork actions are dependent on the motivation systems of the backend AI, but it adapts to your preferences, your way of speaking, etc... Pseudoforks are commonly used as angels . Resurrection insurance : [...] Shell : An artificial body that can be controlled from the inside by someone. Shells come in various shapes and functions. Singularity : An AGI that developed beyond transhuman intelligence. Singularities are feared as they may be too powerful to be controlled and because it's extremely hard to tune their objectives parameters in a safe way. Synthshell : [...]

docs.text: Transhumanity Introduction Ego, Shells and Angels In Silicon Dust, ego technology profoundly changed humanity and societies. The core idea of this technology is to digitalize the brain and run a near-perfect simulation of it in artificial brains. This allowed to directly interface our minds to technology. Since our minds could be stored as data, what's called an ego , the death of our body is not the death of the mind since a data save of the ego can be reloaded into another body. Bodies are shells now and egos can be loaded in these shells. The Grid The Grid is the transhuman evolution of internet. From internet it kept the concept of being a communication network. But the Grid is much more than that. It's an ecosystem of various subnetworks, communications systems, protocols and habitat and things meshes all connected to one another through gateways and backdoors. The Grid varies from habitat to habitat. Habitat subnetworks come in all shades of surveillance, transparency, encryption level, anonymity, accessibility, services, reputation systems, ... In habitat with fascistic tendencies it may be hard to connect to the rest of the Grid, you may need a contact with access to a stealth satellite or admin access. In others, the Grid may easily be accessed but is easily traceable if you do not take proper precautions. In free habitats, anonymity may be a protocol-level feature allowing for free and anonymous access to the Grid. Grid inserts Everyone, or almost everyone, has grid inserts in their shell, which are a set of augmentations designed to wirelessly connect to the Grid and interface it with your sensory systems. Grid inserts lets you and your angel access information on the grid, add layers of holograms in your perception and enter simulspaces. Accessing the Grid Some systems offer free and secured access to the Grid, but others have ego verification measures and automatic surveillance AIs. In general, even if there is an authoritarian regime in charge, there is always some resistance running micro-satellites providing a connection to the rest of the Grid, you just have to find them. Note that because of the distance between stellar bodies, the Grid is asynchronous. Data from Pluto may not be accessible immediately from Mercury. However, Alternate reality and the Mesh The Grid is also composed of layers and layers of virtual elements covering the physical reality of habitats. Your perception of habitats is enriched of holographic displays, spatialized sounds and even virtual taste and flavor. Parts of this alternate reality comes from your applications : a map application will display a minimap in your view field or indicate markers in the environment, social utils and network clients may print a data bubbles and public profiles of people surrounding you, weapon detection systems may highlight detected weapon in your view field, ... Another layer of alternate reality comes from your direct environment. Most habitat structures and objects are directly interconnected forming the Mesh : the aggregate of embedded data and utilities. Doors may give you access data, the lightning system of rooms may be accessible, holographic advertising and tags cover the walls, weapons may print information such as the remaining ammo and the coils temperature, ... Off-grid, society looks weird, people talk to invisible people, they make movements in the air, they seem to see things that are not there, ... When you create an habitat, ask yourself what is the basic experience of the local mesh ? Is it standardized or diverse ? Minimalistic or saturated ? Functional or aesthetic ? When you create your character, ask yourself how you configure your alternate reality settings ? What utilities you always have directly available ? What kind of experiences your angel filters or lets through in your perception ? Virtual reality and simulspaces Another aspect of the everyday experience of transhumanity is virtual reality. Simulspaces are artificial virtual spaces allowing seemingly real experiences by transmitting perceptual data directly into grid inserts. Simulspaces of various sizes, populations and designs coexist in the Grid. Some are huge immersive games, others are virtual offices for corporations, others are artificial landscapes for virtual tourism, others are individual relaxation spaces, others are huge social cities, ... What you can do in simulspace depends on its programming. Some sandbox simulspaces give a lot of possibilities to build things but others only lets you move. The physics of simulspaces may be very realistic or outright weird with non-euclidean physics or anything in between. Simulspace time may go faster than real time but there may be limits to that. All shells allow to create their own personal simulspaces and grid inserts allow people to access simulspaces on the Grid. While you may be blocked doing things in simulspaces, you may always log out as long as you have control of your grid inserts. However, an cortical stack running in an ego loader may not be able to log out allowing for effective accelerated torture. Society Human societies evolved into transhuman societies. ego technology removed the fear of death and profoundly shifted the spiritual values. Old religions couldn't keep up with the leap and new religions emerged. After the Fall, old states perished leaving the corporations taking the Overton window. They associated under the name of the Consortium.

docs.text: First session Everyone chooses a playbook, fills it and answers the question. Everyone creates the background. Everyone creates a organisation. Everyone creates the initial habitat they're on and how they fit in it. Everyone fills their Hx and tells how their revelations are. Choosing a playbook Just pass the playbooks and let the players choose their favourite. Creating the background Between 100 and 200 years from now, humanity had invented ego technology allowing people to be scanned, saved and loaded into other artificial bodies called shells. The development of neural interfaces allowed advanced prosthesis and augmentations. Space elevators allowed the colonization of the solar system. The centuries long process of Mars terraformation had begun using cutting edge nanotechnologies and biotechnologies. Not all humanity was augmented or wandering the solar system. Most of humanity still didn't have their ego scanned or never left Earth's ground, but some companies, states, tech-enthusiasts and outcasts were colonizing the solar system when the cataclysm happened. A cataclysm of epic proportion wiped out humanity on Earth and forced the rise of transhumanity. Since then, transhumanity is scattered in the solar system under the rules of transhuman quasi-states. Why went wrong on Earth, causing the annihilation of humanity and the rise of transhumanity ? Players choose 1, MC chooses 1 secretly. - World War III. - Rogue AI. - Nanotechnology event. - Alien encounter. - Unliveable climate. - Biological threat. - Physically mysterious event. - Technological accident (experiment gone wrong, ...). - Something else ? Players get to tell how their choice gone wrong, how it manifested and how it's remembered. How is Earth today ? Players choose 1, MC chooses 1. - Dangerous nanotech clouds and colonies. - Earth disappeared (how did it happen ?). - Heavy radiation (coming from where ?). - Rogue robots roam the place (doing what ?). - Something forbids passage (what ?). - Superstorms, acid rains, killing heat waves, ocean rising, ... - The New Overton Window has a unique access to Earth. - There are still people there (how do they survive ?). - Weird lifeforms roam the place (how are they weird ?). - Something else ? Creating the New Overton Window The New Overton Window represents the main political structure that governs most of transhumanity. The New Overton Window is a hypercapitalistic conglomerate of megacorporations. These megacorp run colonies Creating Organisations Each player creates an organisation at the beginning of the Characterize your organisation (choose as many as you want) : - Anarchist/Minarchist/Multiarchist federation. - Anarcho-capitalist. - Anarcho-communist. - Authoritarian/Fascist. - Cast system. - Corporation. - Criminal. - Democracy (direct/indirect ?) - Earth-era state. - Exhuman. - Hive-mind. - Militarized. - Outcast. - Religious cult. - Scientific. - Secret network. - Technoconservatism (in which way ?). Where are they located (choose 1 or 2) : - Inside various societies (which ones ?). - Mercury. - Venus. - Moon. - Mars (Phobos, Deimos). - Asteroid belt (Vesta, Juno, Ceres, Pallas, ...). - Jupiter (Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto). - Saturn (Enceladus, Tethys, Rhea, Titan, Hyperion, ...). - Uranus (Miranda, Ariel, ...). - Neptune (Triton). - In the Cybers (where are their servers though ?). - Somewhere else (Deep in the Oort cloud, Beyond the gates, ...). What are their ressources (choose 2 to 4) : - Army and armaments. - Art and entertainment. - Carbon. - Communication network. - Cryptobanking services. - Freedom. - Metal mining. - Oxygen refining. - Raw materials. - Scientific progress. - Secret intelligence. - Social care. - Tourism and luxe. - Vegetation. - Water. Characterize their habitats (choose 3 to 5) : - 0g. - Archipelagos. - Artificial gravity. - Asteroids. - Baroque. - Centralized. - Chaotic. - Cramped. - Domes. - Fancy. - Functional. - Highly secured. - In bad shape. - Industrial. - Lots of vegetation. - Minimalist. - Recuperation. - Satellites. - Spacious. - Special atmosphere. - Sturdy. - Vertical. Say what they're known for : - Anonymity. - Army. - Engineering. - Fleet. - Food. - Freedom. - High-end technology. - Luxe. - Material extraction. - Religion. - Research. - Savagery. - Specialized shells. - Strict rules. - Surveillance. - Transparency. - ... Habitat An habitat is an artificial construct designed for transhuman to live in. Habitats come in various shapes and functionnalities : - Aerostats are mobile stations supported by floating balloons in the dangerous atmospheres of Venus, Jupiter and Saturn. Aerostats benefits from the natural bodies of their planets. They use atmosphere processors to convert the external atmosphere into usable raw material but they always need mining importations for hard materials. On Venus, aerostats descend towards the planet surface at mining facilities to reload their stocks. - Beehives are habitats drilled in asteroids. They consists of connected clusters of corridors and rooms. Beehives are interface with the void of space through pressurized locks. Most beehives have an external spaceport whethere as a small intellidome or a hard-material building. As they are built in asteroids, they usually are microgravity environments and consequently have confusing 3D architecture for transhumans not used to 0-g designs. Some modern beehives control and are built as arrays of concentric circles to use the asteroid rotation as artificial gravity. Beehives first use the rock and ice of their host asteroid as raw material for fabrication. - Intellidomes are habitats built on terrestrial planets and asteroids. They consist of several layers of programmable nanotech that separates the dome internal atmosphere from the void of space or the planet's atmosphere. These programmable layers allow for shuttles with authorization to enter and exit the dome by opening and closing themselves in order to minimize atmosphere losses while allowing shuttles to come and go. Intellidomes are not always domes, they can be of various reconfigurable shapes but the term comes from early adoptions of this technology. Intellidomes can selectively filter light and radiation in order to protect its population and to recreate day-night cycles. They come in various sizes, from small stations of a few dozen meters to large cities of a few kilometers. - O'Neill cylinders are huge nanocarbon cylinders rotating around their central axis to provide artificial gravity. Habitations are built [...] - Space stations are habitats orbiting around a massive planetary or stellar body. Orbital stations are orbiting around a singular body, usually a planet while Lagrange stations are located at the stable lagrange points of some planet orbits.

Awareness and perceptiveness : roll +Sensors. Calculations and anticipation : roll +Process. Sociability and manipulation : roll +Memetics. Success : You do it. Awareness and perceptiveness : roll +Sensors. Calculations and anticipation : roll +Process. Sociability and manipulation : roll +Memetics. Success : You give or take +2-forward or -2-forward (you can distribute them). Partial : You give or take +1-forward or -1-forward (you can distribute them). Miss : Prepare for the worst. Infiltrate [+Sensors] When you try to be stealthy to avoid a problem or pass through an area, roll +Sensors. Success : You go unnoticed. Miss : You're detected but you have a small window to prevent the alert to be transmitted. Deploy violence [+Kinesics] When you deploy violence , say what you want and roll +Kinesics. Success : Choose 2 : You inflict +1-harm. You suffer -1-harm. Take control of something/someone/someplace. Force someone to move where you want or stop moving. Take or give +1-forward. Partial : Choose 1 above and the MC chooses above against you or below : You spend 1-ammo. You attract attention. Miss : Prepare for the worst. Exchange harm as established. Suffer harm [+Harm] When you suffer harm , roll +Harm suffered (after armor is substracted) against a difficulty of 1. "Miss" : You endure the damage. Intimidate [+Kinesics] When you want someone to do something and you threaten them , tell them what you want them to do and what you'll do to them if they don't do it. You loose track of something. "Miss" : Reshell [+Trauma] When you wake up in a new shell , roll your current trauma against an difficulty of 1 if your new shell is similar, a difficulty of 2 if different and a difficulty of 3 if the new shell is exotic or horrific. Success : You accept your reshelling. Partial : You have a hard time accepting this shell. You have -1-ongoing until you've done something to feel ok in this shell. Miss : You freak out. You suffer 1-trauma and have -1-ongoing until you've done something to feel ok in this shell. Resist hacking [+Process] When you're getting hacked , roll +Process. Success : Your antivirus manages to contain the penetration. Partial : Choose between going off-grid or not. If you stay connected, the MC chooses 2. If you go off-grid , the MC chooses 1 : One of your augs, items or locomotion mode breaks (MC chooses) : +broken . You suffer 1-harm ap . Your wallet is penetrated : you loose 1-cred . You suffer 1-trauma . The virus is resilient, it stays hidden and may reactivate at the MC's discretion (in this case, you must roll Resist hacking again). A spyware is deployed and captures your data. The damage is irreparable : +destroyed instead of +broken . You overload their sensory inputs : +overload . They get a fork of your ego. Miss : You're infected, the MC chooses 3 above or 1 below : You're out of action : unconscious, glitched or deactivated. Choose your type : bio or synth Choose your augs according to your archetype and expertise. Choose your locomotion modes. Choose your look. Define your Angel or Daemon. Get your Gear and assets from your archetype and expertise. Get your special moves from your archetype and expertise. Archetypes Archetypes represent a mix of social position, motivations, identity and subgenre themes. At the character creation, every player chooses an archetype. The Async awakened with mysterious psi abilities. Play the Async if you want to add metaphysical mysteries in your adventure, if you want to have weird powers beyond scientific comprehension and if you want to be on the run, tracked by organizations wanting to secure you as an asset, experiment on you or simply eliminate you. The Captain owns and pilots a space shuttle and manages his crew. Play the Captain if you want to travel amongst the solar system in your own terms and if you want to be a leader. The Construct is an artificial sentience in search of its purpose. Play the Construct if you want to understand what's left of humanity in transhumanity and what's your role in it. The Entertainer produces entertainment for its community. Play the Entertainer if you want to express yourself, be a star and have a community of followers. The Exec is a corporate agent enacting the interests of a megacorporation. Play the Exec if you want to be deep in corpo drama, if you like the luxe and the privilege it gives and if you're ready to be ruthless to keep it. The Exhuman is a transhuman searching to go beyond transhumanity. Play the Exhuman if you want to explore what's attainable beyond transcendance and what's left of humanity afterwards. The Exolog is fascinated by alien technology. Play the Exologist if you want to explore alien archeological sites in the weird and wonderful worlds beyond the gates. The Radical is an activist that fights for its cause. Play the Radical if you want to be a revolutionary defending its cause whatever the cost. The Shadow is a freelancing operative working in the shadows. Play the Shadow if you want to be a competent freelancer and if you don't care who's paying you to do stuff. Expertise Expertise represents area of competences. Every character chooses an expertise at the creation (except the Shadow who chooses 2 ?) : Design : The art of designing, modifying and repairing things. Droning : The art of building and piloting drones. Hacking : The art of penetrating and subverting information system. Investigation : The art to track people and information. Memegineering : The art of understanding and manipulating people and society. Psychosurgery : The art of studying and operating directly into the psyche of people. Specops : The art of military special operations. Background Activist : You come from a community of radical activists. What are their cause and how did you ended embracing it ? Where are they based and how are they considered by the societies they're based in ? What are your obligations as a member of this organisation ? Construct : You are an artificial intelligence. Do you know who created you and do you know why ? What are your first memories as an AI ? Do you hide your true identity ? How did you build your personality ? If you know which entity created you, are they an organization, a corporation or a single individual ? Corpo slave : You are owned by a corporation. Which one and how did you ended in their hands ? What is the nature of the bond between you and them and what do you do for them ? Are you still in their hands or did you manage to escape ? If you escaped, what do you risk if they catch you ? Criminal : You're part or were part of a criminal organization. Who are they and what do they do ? How did you enter it ? What is/were your part in it ? If you're not part of them anymore, how did you leave and why do they resent and track you ? Drifter : You were part of a nomadic group. They may be traders, pirates, scavengers, ... Why do they live nomadically and where do they usually travel ? What do they do and what was your part in it ? What parts of the system did you explore ? How would they react if you met them again ? Outer : You come from a fringe society outside the Consortium. It may be an weird anarchist community, an isolated religious cult, an habitat ruled by a tyrant, an utopian society, ... Where are they and how do they live ? What are their structural memes and their political organization ? What make them fringe ? What are their relations with other groups and what is/was your place in it ? Veteran : You were a soldier in one or several brutal war. What was these war about and how were they brutal ? Were you on the winning or the loosing side ? How and when did you live your former life and how did you manage to reintegrate into society ?

Droning : The art of building and piloting drones. Hacking : The art of penetrating and subverting information system. Investigation : The art to track people and information. Memegineering : The art of understanding and manipulating people and society. Psychosurgery : The art of studying and operating directly into the psyche of people. Specops : The art of military special operations.

docs.text: Activist : You come from a community of radical activists. What are their cause and how did you ended embracing it ? Where are they based and how are they considered by the societies they're based in ? What are your obligations as a member of this organisation ? Construct : You are an artificial intelligence. Do you know who created you and do you know why ? What are your first memories as an AI ? Do you hide your true identity ? How did you build your personality ? If you know which entity created you, are they an organization, a corporation or a single individual ? Corpo slave : You are owned by a corporation. Which one and how did you ended in their hands ? What is the nature of the bond between you and them and what do you do for them ? Are you still in their hands or did you manage to escape ? If you escaped, what do you risk if they catch you ? Criminal : You're part or were part of a criminal organization. Who are they and what do they do ? How did you enter it ? What is/were your part in it ? If you're not part of them anymore, how did you leave and why do they resent and track you ? Drifter : You were part of a nomadic group. They may be traders, pirates, scavengers, ... Why do they live nomadically and where do they usually travel ? What do they do and what was your part in it ? What parts of the system did you explore ? How would they react if you met them again ? Outer : You come from a fringe society outside the Consortium. It may be an weird anarchist community, an isolated religious cult, an habitat ruled by a tyrant, an utopian society, ... Where are they and how do they live ? What are their structural memes and their political organization ? What make them fringe ? What are their relations with other groups and what is/was your place in it ? Veteran : You were a soldier in one or several brutal war. What was these war about and how were they brutal ? Were you on the winning or the loosing side ? How and when did you live your former life and how did you manage to reintegrate into society ?

docs.text: Gear and assets Creds In transhuman time, there are multiple currencies all embedded in an intricate blockchain market ecosystem. What counts as money varies a lot in the different habitats : some habitats use labor time as the measure of money, in others trust and community service is money, in others fame and influence is money, ... But all these things end up at some point digitalized in a block of a local blockchain and all blockchains permeates others through more or less legal cryptomarkets. In mechanical terms, currency is measured as cred. Everything that has a price costs some cred. Creds can be acquired as services for the community in autonomous societies, as work for a client or a corporation, as information or entertainment, ... Creds are stored in virtual encrypted wallets accessible only if you got the private keys. Cred is represented with the tag n-cred . Gear tags Gear have tags which represents facts about the gear, limitations, special rules and capacities, ... Here is a list of all gear tags : area : This item ignores gang armor. n-ap : The harm inflicted by this item ignores n armor . If the tag is only ap , it ignores all armor . n-armor : When you suffer harm, you substract armor to the harm received. automatic : You can spend 1-ammo to inflict +1-harm or to have the area tag. braced : This technology must be attached to a brace point to be used. breach : The harm it deals cuts holes in hard material (walls, vehicles, ...). broken : This gear is broken. It cannot be used until it's repaired. clumsy : A big and heavy item. It can't be stealthy and it's almost certainly loud. dangerous : On a miss, the user suffers harm. destroyed : This item is broken and cannot be repaired. emp : This device creates a strong electromagnetic pulse that fries electronics. Against a synthshell, it does double damage. Against a bioshell, it breaks at least one aug ( +broken ). Against an unprotected device, it fries it. faraday : It's protected against the effect of emp . hand , close , near , far , away : The range of the gear. Hand means melee, close means a dozen meters, near means a few dozens meters, far means a hundred meters, away means a few hundreds meters. n-harm : Inflicts n harm (see harm). loud : Attracts attention by making big noise, big light, big variation in electromagnetic fields, ... mutilate : When someone suffers harm from this item, they automatically loose a limb. off-grid : This item is not wirelessly connected to the Grid. You must have a physical attack vector against it. overload : This gear overloads the target's sensors, they are malfunctionning until calibrated again. As a PC, you have -1-ongoing and can't roll +Sensors moves until you have time to calibrate again. For NPCs, this technology blinds them except if they have countermeasures. repair : This gear is easily repaired : it costs no cred and takes little time. retrieve : This gear only has 1-ammo but you can retrieve it. If you're still here after the fight, you get your ammo back. If you want to retrieve your ammo during a fight, you must Act under pressure . seeker : This object projectiles automatically correct their trajectories to hit the designated target. You have +1 when you Deploy violence using this item. stealthy : Replaces loud . It means that this gear is hidden and only a thorough search will reveal it. n-stun : Stun harm that incapacitates non-lethally, it replaces harm. n-use : This item has a number of uses. vector : When this item is in contact with an off-grid target, it counts as an attack vector for Hacking purposes. This tag is mostly for ammo : shoot a bullet into an off-grid target and you may hack them. Shells Shells are the transhuman bodies. Since the invention of cortical stacks, the concept of individuality shifted to differentiate even more the difference between bodies (shells) and minds (ego). There are 3 main types of shells : Infoshells are virtual "bodies" connected to the Grid. Infoshells consist of a Mind Processing Unit that is usually connected to the Grid. As infoshells are not really a physical body, they cannot have usual augmentations. A infoshell character may not do physical actions and moves but still may have effects on the real world through the Grid. However, an infoshell may have a +Process or +Memetics bonuses as augs as if it was a Computation chip or a Social utils and has an equivalent of Grid inserts if it has a connection to the Grid. All physical shells (bio and synth) emulate infoshells when they connect to the Grid through Grid inserts . In simulspaces, infoshells can look like almost anything in the constraints of the simulspace programs. Bioshells are biological bodies. Bioshells may come through organic reproduction of compatible bioshells or may be clones fast grown in vats. Almost all bioshells are genetically fixed from congenital disorders and have basic biological augmentations such as a reinforced immunitary system. Bioshells Synthshells are synthetic bodies. They are made of metals and artificial composites. A "naked" synthshell costs 2-cred while a "naked" bioshell costs 3-cred . Add to that the corresponding cred of the basic augs it has and you have the final price. Directly buying shells isn't cheap and that's the reason for resurrection insurances. Cortical stacks [...] Augs Augs are devices directly integrated into a shell. A n-aug cost depends on the following rules : A 0-aug costs nothing. A 1-aug costs 2-cred . A 2-aug costs 5-cred upfront. If you already have an equivalent 1-aug , it costs 3-cred to upgrade. A 3-aug costs 10-cred upfront. If you already have an equivalent 2-aug , it costs 5-cred to upgrade. Basic augs Aesthetics augs 0-aug : Aesthetics augmentations. Choose any : facial reconstruction, fur, biosimulated appearance, dynamic tatoos, programmable skin pigmentation, cat ears, frontal horns, programmable hairs, ... Computation chip n-aug : Adds +n Process (max +3). Choose n : quantum processor, cloud computing, bruteforce units, heuristics encoding, math and logic solvers, ... Defence measures n-aug : Adds +n-armor (max +3). Choose n : epidermic kevlar, nanocarbon-reinforced bones, magnetic decelerator, ... Enhanced strength n-aug : Adds +n-harm (max +3) when inflicting harm with your strength. Choose n : synthetic muscles, high newton actuators, ... Fast healing / Autorepair 1-aug : Your body heals or repair itself fast. Whenever an hour or two passes, you erase all tracks on your Harm Clock. Grid inserts 0-aug : Grid inserts is the basic package of almost every shells. Grid inserts comprises a wireless connection to the Grid and the integration of the Grid to the shell's sensory systems. As such, it allows you to access the Grid directly or through your angel, to jack in the Grid and simulspaces, to make Grid related moves, to perceive the layers of alternate reality covering real places, ... Integrated weapon 1-aug : Design a weapon according to the rules : it costs +1-cred to be integrated. Kinesthesic enhancements n-aug : Adds +n Kinesics (max +3). Choose n : nervous autostimulation, internal optic fiber wiring, Thz streaming, fast-access actuators, adrenaline regulator, hyperthreading, ... Motricity actuators 1-aug : All shells ships with a free basic motricity actuator which are generally legs. For different or additional modes of transportation, choose 1 : flight (wings, propeller, ...), swim (fins, propeller, ...), wall climbing (grappling, magnetic crampon, adhesive limbs, ...), ... Sensors array n-aug : Adds +n to Sensors (max +3). Choose n : magnifying vision, IR and UV vision, echolocation, electromagnetic sensitivity, radiation sensor, organic composites sorter, ... Social utils n-aug : Adds +n to Memetics (max +3). Choose n : facial recognition, body-language analyser, pheromone synthesizer, memetic lexer, predictive discourse, personality correlator, ... Specific augs Antimatter bomb 2-aug 6-harm ap breach area far : When you want or just before dying, you can activate an internal antimatter bomb that deals 6-harm ap breach area in a far range. It kills you instantaneously, destroys your cortical stack as well as the cortical stacks of every shells killed by the explosion. Integrated antimatter bombs are rare and usually forbidden and almost exclusively used suicide missions and terrorism. Ballistics softwares 1-aug : Aiming correction and predictive ballistic stabilization giving a bonus of +1 when you're Deploying violence with a ranged weapon. Brace point 1-aug : You have a retractable gyroscopic arm that allows you to use braced directly on you shell. Close combat softwares 1-aug : Softwares such as kinesthesic analyses or adversary positioning prediction giving a bonus of +1 when you're Deploying violence with melee weapons or with "bare hands". Dead switch 1-aug : A small box containing a small nanoswarm designed to destroy the cortical stack on command or when the shell dies. This aug is used when you don't want your ego to fall in wrong hands. Extreme adaptation mods n-aug : Allows you to ignore certain kind of dangers and damages. For each n, your shell is adapted to 2 : extreme heat, extreme cold, 0g or low-g, high-g, void and high-pressure, radiation, under water, ... Fractal digits 1-aug : A set of fractally dividing digits to manipulate matter at the molecular level. Integrated ego loader* 1-aug : Allows you to load an cortical stack directly into your integrated simulspace. This aug allows you to interact in this simulspace with the ego and perform Psychosurgery*** on them. You can control whether the ego has access or not to your perceptions and you can give them control of your shell. Integrated electron impulser 1-aug : Allows to manipulate off-grid technology at a close range. Quantum relay 2-aug : A quantum relay allows you to instantaneously upload your ego, Angel and software to a server anywhere in the universe when you die. This allows to always retain the memory of your last moments. Stealth enhancements* 1-aug : This augmentations usually comes as sheets of epidermic metamaterials and silenced actuators giving a bonus of +1 to Infiltrate***. Throwing mods n-aug : You can throw anything at superhuman ranges and precision ( 1-aug : close/near , 2-aug : close/near/far , 3-aug : close/near/far/away ). Resurrection insurance Since ego technology has appeared, resurrection insurance were put in place. The principle is simple, you regularly upload your ego in a server used as a backup and when you die, the insurance loads your backup in a new shell if it hasn't retrieved your cortical stack. Various levels of insurance allow for various levels of service. In mechanical terms you must pay your insurance at the beginning of the session. You can select any level of insurance as long as you have the cred to pay it. If you die during the session, you benefit from the insurance, if you don't die, well, too bad. Resurrection insurance levels : 0-cred resurrection insurance : Regular backup and minimal infoshell processing in case you die. 1-cred resurrection insurance : Regular backup and 2-aug shell, the MC describes its type and look. 2-cred resurrection insurance : Regular backup and a 4-aug shell, you detail its type and look. 3-cred resurrection insurance : Regular backup and an identical shell with as many aug as you had when died or a tailored 6-aug shell, you detail its type and look. Angel/Daemon An angel is an intelligent device that allows you to access and retrieve information, connect to other devices, communicate with the Grid, run your softwares, ... It's essentially a intelligent multi-purpose computer. It can be a portable device with a screen and buttons or can be an integrated aug that interfaces with your augmented reality. Often, it has an intelligent interface that is a pseudofork of its owner. A daemon is exactly the same thing except it's designed to anonymize its user and encrypt its communications. Some models even control your angel to make it look like you're elsewhere doing something else. Common in societies that value privacy but forbidden in authoritarian regimes. Frame (choose 1) : Handgun : 2-harm close/near 2-ammo loud Shotgun : 3-harm area close 2-ammo loud Assault rifle : 3-harm close/near automatic 2-ammo loud Machine gun : 4-harm close/near automatic braced clumsy 2-ammo loud Long rifle : 3-harm near/far 2-ammo loud Projectiles (choose 1, +1-cred for another) : Acid spray ammo : +1-ap Ammunition nanofab : +retrieve Diamond-plated ammo : +1-ap EMP ammo : +emp Explosive ammo : +1-harm +breach +dangerous Flechette : +flechette (optional : -harm ) Grappling : +grappling Hacking vector ammo : +vector High velocity ammo : +1-harm Magnetic ammo : +retrieve Nanobarbed ammo : +2-ap dangerous Particle beam : +1-ap Radioactive ammo : +contamination(radioactivity) +dangerous Seeker ammo : +seeker Shrapnel ammo : +1-harm Spreading ammo : +area Mods (choose 1, +1-cred for another) : Automatic fire : +automatic Easily repaired : +repair Integrated : it's a 1-aug Long range : +1 range category Magazine surplus : +1-ammo Off grid : +off-grid ( +0-cred as an additional mod) Stealthy : -loud +stealthy Examples : Rapture EV1 : 4-harm close/near automatic 2-ammo 2-cred loud . An automatic gun with high velocity shrapnel ammo commonly used by street thugs. Queen Cobra II : 3-harm +1-ap close/near automatic 1-ammo stealthy retrieve 5-cred . A silent gun loaded with diamond-plated and shrapnel ammo for maximal lethality, several autofires options and magnetic autoretrieve to leave no traces behind. This gun is made of reinforced silk and has a foldable design in order to bypass security checks. Falcon's Eye 4k : 3-harm 2-ap near/far/away seeker 2-ammo stealthy dangerous 3-cred off-grid . A long range sniper with seeker nanobarbed ammo and autocalibrating stabilizers allowing for millimetre precision shots at up to 4km. This sniper can be dismounted in smaller parts to pass security checks. Valhalla 15 : 5-harm breach close/near automatic braced clumsy dangerous 3-ammo loud 1-cred . A huge machine gun with a large magazine for sustained fire and explosive ammo to shoot through walls. Melee weapons Electrostaff 2-harm emp hand 1-cred : A staff with electromagnetic impulsers at the tips. Monofilament whip 3-harm close mutilate dangerous 1-cred : A handle that releases a monomolecular filament. Very dangerous to use. Vibroknife 2-harm hand 0-cred : A knife whose blade vibrates at ultrasonic frequencies to cut flesh like butter. Vibrosword 3-harm hand 1-cred : A sword with the same technology as the vibroknife. All these melee weapon can be stealthy 1-aug for +1-cred : Examples : Mantis blades 3-harm hand stealthy 1-aug : Two vibroblades hidden in each forearm. A common aug for old operatives. Integrated monofilament whip 3-harm close mutilate dangerous stealthy 1-aug : A monofilament whip aug that is generally hidden in a finger. Grenades Explosive grenade : 4-harm breach area 1-cred Emp grenade : 2-harm emp area 1-cred Sensory overload grenade : overload area 1-cred Nanowire shrapnels grenade : 4-harm 2-ap mutilate breach area dangerous 2-cred Wearables Transhuman clothes are highly multifunctional. Standard autocleaning clothes are 0-cred but you may add the following mods : Armored +n-cred : Gives you +n-armor (max +3). If your already have Defence measures , you cannot exceed a total of +3-armor . Exoskeleton +n-cred : Gives you +n-harm (max +3) when inflicting harm with your strength. If you already have Strength enhancements , you cannot exceed a total of +3-harm . Reconfigurable +1-cred : This wearable can change its shape and color to resemble any other wearable. Thermo-optic cammo* +1-cred : The fabric is covered by metamaterials bending electromagnetic radiation in order to make the wearer appear invisible. It gives +1 to Infiltrate* . If you already have Stealth enhancements , it has no effect. Vacsuit +1-cred : Allows their bioshell host to breath oxygen and protect them against the void, oceanic pressures, temperatures in the +-200°C range and standard cosmic radiations. The vacsuit gives you 48 hours of autonomy and recharges automatically when you enter an oxygenated area. You can spend an additional 1-cred to add an additional extreme environment protections : radioactivity, extreme hotness/coldness, ... Services Services allow you to roll expertise moves you don't have. In general, a 1-cred services allow you to roll once (medical assistance, repair, ...) or for the time of a session or the operation (hacking support, a gang, ...) with a +2 bonus. Here are a list of additional costs : A +3 bonus : +1-cred A +4 bonus : +2-cred Week long services : +1-cred Month long services : +2-cred For gangs : The base gang is a gang small 2-harm hand/close/near 0-armor . You may choose as much additional tags as the cred you spent to engage the gang. A larger gang is +1-cred by size category. Gangs Gang tags small , medium , large : A gang inflicts +1-harm and has +1-armor for each additional size category it has against its opponent. tiny : Does +1-harm but does not have +1-armor when fighting against an individual. Drones Vehicles Robots Nanotech Nanocleaner 1-cred 2-use : A nanoswarm erasing all physical traces of transhuman presence in a place. Also deletes other forms of nanotech. Nanofoam 1-cred 2-use : A nanoswarm aggregating as metallic foam to obstruct holes and seal accesses. Nanotracker 1-cred 2-use : A discreet nanoswarm tracking the surface it's on. Devices Ego loader* 1-cred : A device allowing you to load an ego into a simulspace to interact with it and perform Psychosurgery*** on it. Electron impulser 1-cred vector close : Allows you to hack off-grid targets in a close range.

docs.text: Construct The construct is an artificial being searching for the meaning of its life and its relationship to transhumanity. Characteristics By default, you have +1 in all your core characteristic. Your shell characteristics depends on your augs. Humanity The Construct in in search of its purpose and transhumanity is its only model. As such, the Construct gains and spend Humanity according to its moves. You start with 0 Humanity. Humanity : ___ Angel You do not have an angel. Shell At character creation you have (choose 1) : An infoshell with +2 Process. A synthshell indiscernible from a human from the outside with 3-aug . A artificial looking synthshell with 3-aug . A human bioshell with 3-aug . Spend your aug to select your starting augmentations (see Gear). Gear You start with no gear and cred . Expertise At character creation, choose an expertise and get its Gear and assets, Gigs and Moves. Connections At the beginning of the first session, ask to other players : "Which one of you found me and took me under its wing ?" They are the first people you meet and the first human you study (see the Humans move). XP and Improvements When you roll a highlighted characteristic or if a move tells you to, you win XP. When you have 5 XP, you may choose one of the following improvement : Get a new move from your archetype. Get a new move from your expertise. After your fifth improvement, you may also choose : Increase by 1 your core characteristic (max +2). Get a new expertise. Construct moves At character creation, you have the Remember , Humans and Stigma moves. You may choose other Construct moves as improvements. Remember Whenever you spend 1 Humanity to answer a question about yourself , roll +3 against 1. The MC may ask you or not to do something before to unlock the question. Success : The MC chooses the question and you answer it. Partial : You choose the question and the MC answers it. Miss : The MC chooses the question and answers it. Questions : [ ] What's my true first memory ? [ ] When was I created ? [ ] What do I remember of my creator(s) ? [ ] How do I perceive my own mind ? [ ] Are there others like me ? [ ] Was I created in the image of someone ? [ ] Did I commit crimes before ? What were they ? [ ] What was my original purpose ? [ ] Does humanity fascinates me ? Why ? When you answered all the questions , you have a Revelation : Realize humanity is only a step and you're the next one. Leave humanity to become something different. This character becomes a NPC and you create a new character. Realize humanity is a disease and you're the cure. This character becomes a NPC and you create a new character. Realize you are or may become a human too. You loose all your Construct moves and choose a new archetype. Realize your existence has no meaning and kill yourself. Realize you're not human and you have a grand mission (say what it is). You may stay a Construct for now or loose all Construct moves and take a new relevant archetype and may choose another Revelation later. Humans When you decide to study a particular transhuman to understand what makes them human, follow them around. When you think you have figured it out, tell them of something that makes them human or inhuman. If they agree, you gain 2 Humanity, if they disagree, you gain 1 Humanity. Stigma You don't know it yet but most of the societies are against artificial lifeforms. In these societies, being artificial may imply to be property or may simply imply forced deactivation. You will learn it the hard way. Judgement When you witness humanity at its best or at its worst , tell them and gain 1 Humanity. Learn You can spend 1 Humanity to roll any of the expertise moves. Better than human You can spend 1 Humanity to treat a Miss as a Partial or a Partial as a Success. Worse than human When you reveal your artificiality to Intimidate or Deploy violence , you can spend 1 Humanity to have an automatic success. Different You're invulnerable to Trauma. Erase all your current Trauma tracks and you never have to Suffer trauma or suffer the counter-effects when you Reshell .

docs.text: The Radical Name A name you took to defend your cause or a name you were given to defend your cause. The Cause Choose your Cause : A new religion : You're a zealot for a new religion, which one ? An old religion from earth : You're a zealot for an old religion, which one ? What does your Cause entails ? What makes of you an extremist even for this Cause ? How does your Cause judges society ? How do you differentiate between allies and enemies to the Cause ? The Community What are your community's strengths ? (choose 2) : They are vocal on the Grid. They have sub-communities in most habitats. They have a lot of money and resources. They are secrets and decentralized. They are politically soft but mostly accepted by society. They have habitats socially designed around the Cause. What is your community's weakness ? (choose 1) : They are always arguing with each other. They are poors and have few resources. They are isolated. They are few. What's the commonest interpretation of your Cause amongst the community ? How do you think they are wrong about it and should be more radical in their ideas ? What are the subgroups and tendencies inside the community ? Where do they meet ? What are their symbols ? XP and Improvements Radical moves By default, you get the Social change move. Social change When you come in a habitat, create a new social change clock for this habitat, ask the MC how this habitat positions around your Cause. If they're neutral, the Social change clock starts with 3 track filled. If they're mostly hostile, the Social change clock starts with 1 or 2 tracks filled. If they're deadly hostile, the Social change clock starts with 0 tracks filled. During play, situations will add or remove tracks to the Social change clock : When you show to the public the damage caused by enemies to the Cause , add 1 track. When you give the people what they want , add 1 track. When you give the powers what they want , add 1 track. When you severely hurts the interests of enemies to the Cause , add 1 track. When a respected figure takes your Cause side , add 1 track. When yourself or your community publicly makes fools of themselves , remove 1 track. When your or your community's interests severely suffers , remove 1 track. When a respected figure takes side against your Cause , remove 1 track. If the Social change clock hits 6 tracks, you bring social change in this habitat : laws are passed, historical events happen, power is transferred, ... Social change is not always a clean process, your Cause wins, but there may be costs to be paid. If the Social change clock hits 0 tracks, your community is hunted by authorities as priority criminals . If you move to another habitat, create a new Social change clock for this habitat. Partial : You say something they've heard of you and the MC adds something. Miss : The MC says what they've heard of you. You can ask a question from Read a person about the crowd or someone in it. You don't make enemies. The crowd goes back to their business. Squad You have joined or created a small cell of operatives with various expertises dedicated to your Cause. They can throw any expertise move with a +2 bonus for you or serve as a gang small . Sworn enemy When you directly act against an enemy of the Cause or to further your Cause , you have +1 ongoing.

docs.text: Hacking Hacking is the art of penetrating and subverting information technology. When you get the Hacking expertise you get the Gear and Assets, the Gigs, the Pentest move and another Hacking move of your choice. Gear and assets By default you get : A +1-aug computation chip : +1 Process. A daemon with dynamic ego falsification allowing you to bypass common identification trackers. Contrary to most people, what you do is not publicly available information. It still may be retrieved by motivated and competent individuals. Additionally, choose 2 : A private hidden server somewhere safe (you detail) and connected to the Grid with backups of your ego and softwares. It counts as your 0-cred resurrection insurance and provides an infoshell with +1 Process in case you die. Another +1-aug computation chip : +1 Process. A custom weapon worth 2-cred with vector ammo. An integrated ( 1-aug ) or external ( 1-cred ) electron impulser allowing you to have an attack vector against off-grid technology in a close range. Gigs As a hacker, you have access to gigs related to hacking which include : security pentesting, ego stealing, data recovering, surveillance, ... Hacking moves Pentest (Hacking) [+Process] When you're not sure how to hack something and probe the vulnerabilities, roll +Process. Success : The MC tells you of an attack vector and you have +1-forward Hacking it. Partial : The MC tells you of an attack vector. Miss : The MC tells you of an attack vector but you have -1-forward Hacking it. Counter-hacking (Hacking) Whenever you must Resist hacking , you have an attack vector against the assailant. Mesh hacking (Hacking) [+Process] When you hack the local mesh , roll +Process . You must have an attack vector against it. Success : Hold 3. Partial : Hold 1. Miss : Hold 1 but you triggered an alarm or the mesh antivirus has an attack vector against you (MC's choice). Spend your hold 1 for 1 : Create/Eliminate/Subvert an obstacle or a security measure. Get access to the local history. Get a clear view of how to get in/out/away. Manipulate/Subvert the local utilities. Deploy a spyware for alerts and surveillance within the zone. Whenever you spend 1 hold, you can give or take +1-forward. Shell hacking (Hacking) [+Process] When you hack a shell , roll +Process . You must have an attack vector against them. For NPCs : Success : Choose 3 Infections or choose 1 here : They're out of action. You remote control their shell. Partial : Choose 1 Infection. Miss : Choose 1 Infection but prepare for the worst. Infections : One of their augs, items or locomotion mode breaks. You inflict 1-harm ap . You penetrate their wallet : you gain from 1 to 3 cred (MC chooses). You inflict 1-trauma . The virus is resilient and persistent. You deploy a spyware and capture personal data. The damage is irreparable : +destroyed instead of +broken . You inflict a sensory overload . You get a fork of them. For PCs : You trigger the Resist hacking move for them with the number of success dies on your roll as the difficulty. You choose the infections instead of the MC. Virtual tracking (Hacking) [+Process] When you locate something on the Grid , be it an infoshell, a service, a simulspace..., roll +Process . You must have access to a manifestation of them/this on the Grid. Success : You precisely know where they are and have an attack vector against them. Partial : You approximately know where they are. Miss : You approximately know where they are but they also know where you are and may have an attack vector against you. Hack the world (Hacking) [+Process] When you want to perform a global hacking (at the scales of an entire habitat, a society, a fleet, a population, ...), tell the MC what you want to do. The MC must say to you "Sure you can do it but ..." and choose as many as you want : You'll need days/weeks/months crafting the exploit. You must have a physical attack vector in a secure location. You need to acquire a specific device or service. You must first have access to ___ . Once you have all the requirements and you release the exploit , roll +Process . Success : The exploit works in the intended way and you control its deployment. Partial : The exploit works but the MC chooses 2 : You loose control of its deployment. There are unintended side effects. It will not last long. You attract attention. Miss : The exploit works but they have an attack vector against you.

When you get the Memegineering expertise you get the Gear and Assets, the Gigs and a Memegineering move of your choice. Gear and assets By default you get : A +1-aug memetics util : +1 Memetics. Additionally, choose 1 : A daemon with dynamic ego falsification allowing you to bypass common identification trackers. Contrary to most people, what you do is not publicly available information. It still may be retrieved by motivated and competent individuals. Another +1-aug memetics util : +1 Memetics. A weapon worth 2-cred . Gigs As a memegineer, you may have gigs such as marketing placement, disinformation campaign, ... Memegineering moves Body language (Memegineering) You automatically know if people are honest or not, whether you talk to them or not. Community screening (Memegineering) [+Memetics] When you feel the pulse of local communities on the Grid, roll +Memetics . Success : Ask 3. Partial : Ask 1. Miss : Ask 1 but prepare for the worst. Questions : What communities are the most active about ___ ? What communities are the most susceptible to ___ ? Who's the "representative" of this community ? Memetic analysis (Memegineering) When you Analyze behavior , you also can ask these questions : What are their ideologies (about ___ ) ? What are their aesthetics (about ___ ) ? What are their social groups ? What are their original gender or cultural group ? Social engineering (Memegineering) [+Memetics] When you social engineer access to something , roll +Memetics . You must first say who you target, what you want from them, how you approach them and how you trick them. Success : They give it to you or an access to get it (MC's choice). Partial : They give you an opportunity to get it or good information about how to get it (MC's choice). Miss : They see through your lies, prepare for the worst. In any case, if the target learns about your true intentions, they'll hate you for it. Social sponge (Memegineering) You can easily integrate in any social groups when you search for information. When you Investigate by infiltrating groups and subcultures, treat a Miss as a Partial and a Partial as a Success. Propaganda (Memegineering) [+Memetics] When you craft memetic content to manipulate the public opinion and diffuse it on the Grid, roll +Memetics . Always say who your target population is, what beliefs and emotions you wish to propagate and what actions you want the target population to do. Success : The content propagates well, has the intended effects and doesn't get out of control. Partial : Same as success but the MC chooses 2 : It only affects a small portion of the target population. It takes 1-cred to market. It gets out of control. It will only be a fad. You attract attention. Miss : Your memetic content degenerates, prepare for the worst. Weak point (Memegineering) You may Intimidate with +Memetics instead of +Kinesics.

If at least a week passed between sessions and you were able to perform accelerated psychotherapy in the meantime on someone, you can roll this move at the beginning of the session. Success : You heal 2-trauma . Partial : You heal 1-trauma . Miss : You inflict 1-trauma . Behavioral rewiring (Psychosurgery) [+Process] When you perform psychosurgery to implant a command or modify a behavior , roll +Process . Success : You implant a command or suppress a behavioural tendency. Partial : Same as a Success but if the target is unwilling, they suffer 1-trauma . Miss : The rewiring is unsuccessful and you inflict 1-trauma . For PCs : When they go against their rewiring, they must Act under pressure to mitigate the effects. Merging (Psychosurgery) [+Process] When you perform psychosurgery to merge two egos , roll +Process . Success : The merging works. The merged ego gets 2 experience. Partial : The merging mostly works but the cognitive dissonance inflicts 1-trauma . Miss : The merging fails. It inflicts 2-trauma . For PCs : Merge failure may mean multiple personality syndrom. They may have to Act under pressure to keep control at critical moments. Mnemonics (Psychosurgery) [+Process] When you perform psychosurgery to retrieve or alter memories , roll +Process . Success : You retrieve semantic or episodic memories, you may alter or delete them or may add artificial memories. The patient will be mostly unsuspecting except if faced with contradictions. Partial : Same as a success but the patient will have confusing flashes and may retrieve its memory at some point. Miss : Same as a partial but the patient suffers 1-trauma and will retrieve its memory soon. For PCs : When they are faced with a contradiction or something susceptible to make them remember, they may Act under pressure to mitigate the mnemonics operation. Simulspace torture (Psychosurgery) When you torture an ego in a simulspace , for each question you ask, if they resist (MC's choice for NPC and PC's choice for their character), you can inflict them 1-trauma and they have to tell you. If they suffer too much trauma, well, you definitely broke their mind. Experimental psychosurgery (Psychosurgery) Say what you want to accomplish.
